items.title: SoftBank stakes $4B on securing AI data center power and capacity โ DigitalBridge purchase indicative of AI industry's increasing investments in energy supply
items.summary: SoftBank has agreed to acquire DigitalBridge in a deal valuing the digital infrastructure investor at roughly $4 billion, including debt.

items.title: 'He's gone!' - Robinson scores 93-yard touchdown
items.summary: Bijan Robinson runs in a 93-yard touchdown as the Atlanta Falcons beat the Los Angeles Rams 27-24.

items.title: Chinese firms Bytedance and Tencent reportedly offer massive 150% pay increases and 35% bonuses to entice AI talent โ salaries and increases also expected to balloon in 2026
items.summary: Tech companies are spending more on AI-focused employees even as the rest of the industry is laying off hundreds of thousands.

items.title: MSI B850 MPower Motherboard Review: Micro ATX made for overclocking memory
items.summary: MSIโs B850 MPower is a solid all-around motherboard, but excels at memory overclocking, specifically with 8000-series APUs, where speeds over 10,000 MT/s are possible.

items.title: Another 16-pin GPU power connector gets scorched, but this time it's not an RTX 5090 โ User finds their Sapphire Nitro+ 9070 XT with scorched pins
items.summary: The decisions to put a 16-pin power connector on a non-Nvidia GPU has started to show its consequences on the RX 9070 XT. Sapphire's Nitro+ variant uses a 12v-2x6 connector, which has burnt down thrice already, making this the fourth case so far, joining the first ASRock Taichi card that broke the โฆ

items.title: NFL play-off picture - scenarios & big game deciders in season finale
items.summary: The final week of the NFL season is here with the final play-off spots, both top seedings and four division titles to be decided, with three huge head-to-head deciders.

items.title: China tells chipmakers to use homegrown chipmaking tools for 50% of new capacity โ decree designed to squeeze foreign suppliers out of supply chain
items.summary: China has quietly mandated that at least 50% of equipment used for new semiconductor capacity be domestically sourced. However, as China's industry cannot produce enough lithography tools, authorities tend to get flexible and allow foreign alternatives in.

items.title: Open source project brings 53-year-old interface to USB โ GPIB adapter v3 adds integrated Ethernet port with PoE
items.summary: An open source USB to GPIB adapter will soon reach version 3, bringing an integrated Ethernet port with PoE support.

items.title: Grab this 4K gaming PC with an RTX 5080 and 9800X3D for just $2,499 before prices skyrocket โ $200 saving on powerful Skytech rig with 32GB of DDR5 RAM and 1TB SSD
items.summary: This $2,499 Skytech gaming PC is an elite-level rig for gaming at 4K, fitted with an Nvidia GeForce RTX 5080 and an AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D, along with 32GB of DDR5 RAM and a 1TB SSD.

items.title: GOG acquired by co-founder, reiterates philosophy of โfreedom, independence, and genuine controlโ โ CD Projekt sells platform to focus on creating games
items.summary: CD Projekt sells 100% of GOG to co-founder Michaล Kiciลski, allowing the company to focus on new games and upcoming titles under its existing franchises.

items.title: Start-up plans to use terahertz radio frequencies for communication between servers instead of copper or optical connections โ radio-based interconnections offer 1.6 TB/s using half the volume of copper
items.summary: When copper is not enough and yet optical interconnections are overkill, waveguide-based cables can do the job.

items.title: Recovered Unix v4 tape quickly yields a usable operating system โ nostalgia addicts can now boot up Unix v4 in a browser window

items.title: ShaderBeam provides CRT-like motion clarity on high refresh rate LCD and OLED monitors โ open-source project offers BFI emulation in any game
items.summary: Blur Busters has released an overlay that enables its CRT motion clarity emulator to run in Windows and PC games. Gamers can now enjoy the motion-blur-reduction effects of CRT emulation in PC titles.

items.summary: BBC Sport reflects on a stellar year for South Africa which threatens to be overshadowed by a lack of home Test cricket.

items.title: Torvill & Dean and England boss Wiegman recognised in New Year Honours

items.summary: China's first 6nm-class discrete GPUs, the G100 series from Lisuan, has apparently started to ship out to customers, months after their initial announcement. These GPUs, if as performant as claimed, hold the potential to fuel China's self-reliance ambitions in producing homegrown alternatives to Nvโฆ

items.title: TSMC begins quietly volume production of 2nm-class chips โ first GAA transistor for TSMC claims up to 15% improvement at ISO power
items.summary: TSMC has quietly begun volume production of its 2nm-class N2 process in Q4 2025 as planned, marking the companyโs first GAA nanosheet node that will be ramping production at two new fabs to meet strong demand from various customers.

items.title: Title talk in December 'doesn't make sense' - Emery
items.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says it "does not make sense" to speak about the title race in December, after rising to third place in the Premier League.

items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says he has not changed their formation because of "pressure from the media or fans".

items.title: TSMC's average wafer prices increased by over 15% each year since 2019, report suggests โ gross profit margins increase by 3.3x in 2025 alone, facing no real challengers
items.summary: EUV lithography era in chipmaking began in 2019 and there are no signs that this is going to stop as process technologies are getting more complex. However, there are fundamental reasons why TSMC's quotes are rising quicker than its costs and its customers are not leaving for other foundries.

items.title: Former Samsung engineer accused of giving 10nm DRAM data to China's CXMT, handwritten notes detailed over 600 process steps โ gas flow ratios, photoresist settings and more critical stages detailed
items.summary: A former Samsung Engineer accused of offering the secrets behind the company's 10nm DRAM data to China's ChangXin Memory Technologies has been accused of making hundreds of handwritten notes on detailed process steps.
